Sub Process
A
Subprocess
is
an action of the System, which is a separate business process
(BP).
More about BP
.
It supposes the preliminary creation of a business process (for more information, refer to
Setting up business process flow charts
), which will be specified as a
Subprocess
on the flow chart.
Subprocesses are mainly used in the following cases:
To decompose and improve the readability and clarity of flow charts (diagrams)
To describe repetitive actions. Once described business process (subprocess) can be repeatedly called up (used) within other BPs
On the BP flow chart, a subprocess is shown as a rectangle with an icon
.
The subprocess parameters:
where:
Setting
Purpose
Identifier
The display of the BP item identifier is generated automatically.
Name
The display of the item name is generated automatically.
Stage type
The display of the action type is generated automatically.
Object status
Choosing the status of the BP route object.
Subprocess
Selecting a previously configured process to use it in the current BP.
For example, a custom credit workflow lists two types of applications for decision to be considered:
Guarantee is a request for guarantee obligations of the Bank’s Client
Loan is a request for a loan from the Bank’s Client
The flow chart of the overall process will look like this:
That is, after starting the process, the type of application is defined. After that, the System starts the corresponding subprocess. The processes of considering the applications of each type are described by separate BPs according to the Bank requirements.
